pros:
- The other Behavioural Counsellors were great to work with as they didn't micro-manage and appreciated all the hard work we did to support the residents 
- The residents are helpful and enjoyable to do programs with
cons:
- The full-time staff appeared to look at Behavioural Counsellors as just "fill ins" and did not consider important information to be relevant in providing support to residents
- This is extended further in that the pay rate is close to minimum wage despite needing adequate skills and requirements for the position, once again reiterating the feeling of being unappreciated and just "fill ins." Pay is extremely low in comparison to other local agencies 
- The amount of rules are unrealistic to remember no matter how long you've worked there
- Lack of staff means that Behavioural Counsellors have to work significantly more than their required number of shifts and spread themselves thin making work/life balance very different being even a part-time employee. Even full-time staff have to come in EVERY time they are on-call due to staffing issues 
- Moving up in the agency is very difficult due to the high level of requirements needed for most jobs despite it not being necessary
